column11: Review Text
One of the biggest and greatest international conference halls built in Sri Lanka. This building is historic and majestic.

Another impressive building where we had to be satisfied with a couple of drive pasts. Our guide advised that it was a gift from the People's Republic of China as a memorial to former Prime Minister Solomon West Ridgeway Dias Bandaranaike.  Completed in 1973, the complex received a further addition in 1998 with the construction of an Exhibition Centre; this was another gift from the PRC  to honour Sirimavo Bandaranaike, the world's first non-hereditary female head who served as Prime Minister on three occasions, 1960–1965, 1970–1977 and 1994–2000. She was the wife of Solomon. Wonderful beneficence.

The Bandaranaike Memorial International Conference Hall, is a convention center located in Colombo, Sri Lanka. Built between 1970 and 1973, the convention centre was a gift from the People's Republic of China in memory of Solomon Ridgeway Dias Bandaranaike, Prime Minister. A nice place to visit to get a feel of the same. Lot of fairs and programs are organised in the premises. There are food options here. Tourists could have the same in itinerary for a drive by as well just to look at the modern architecture.

Success Depends on How Best #Information is Received & Processed, #Commander of the #Army Lieutenant General #Shavendra #Silva, Commander of the Army in his welcome note at the Colombo ‘Defence Seminar - 2019’ said this morning (29) that the Seminar has been designed to share our experiences, not only necessarily our successes.(photo courtesy SLArmy web.)

Bandaranaike Memorial International Conference Hall is an important land mark in Colombo city. This convention centre is gift from Republic of China and it is centrally located in Colombo.it is a tourist attraction.

The staff member who served us was friendly and helpful. However,  Beware at the checkout if using credit card as they do the conversion from US dollars to another currency , such as GBP, at the checkout.  Subsequently they give a lower rate and you will end up paying more.
This masterpiece is a must for any tourist. The buildings are impeccably maintained and this is a must see in Colombo

Already visited multiple times here for many conferences and exhibitions as well as youth parliament sessions. Recently visited for the Colombo International Book Exhibition on last week of September. This place celebrates a colourful history of being an Icon of Colombo for decades. Erected in early 70s with the help of China Government in memory of former Lankan Premier Late Mr. Bandaranaike, this massive masterpiece stands as the centerpiece of all prominent international events held in Colombo including exhibitions, conferences and convocation ceremonies of state and foreign universities. There is a main building as well as other very spacious halls. The environment is maintained upto international standards. Must visit this architectural masterpiece if you are in Colombo.

column8: Food festival was a bit boring
column11: We attend this food festival which was held in 5 halls. It wasn't to our expectation. It wasn't Good, it was pretty boring and there weren't a lot of good stalls. We just bought tomato rice crackers which were amaZing. They had a hall where there was a chef who made stuff in the spot n gave what he made to the audience to sample. That alone was nice to watch n try out the food. There was also a juice stall there which was good. BIMCH is a great place n is very spacious n all but this event alone was boring.

We visited the book fair and had lunch from  restaurant run by mount lavinia hotel.Food was very good and service also good.I was with my friends and they also so happy about the food.Price also reasonable.If you visit BMICH have a try....

An iconic landmark venue, a combination of versatility, functionality, prestige, ambience and star class service, BMICH is a one stop destination for hosts and guests allowing the creation of an outstanding setting for a wide range of events and occasions.
This is the place where the trade, professionals organize seminars, conference, fair, meetings. This huge building has several institutions, departments and offices. Good place to visit.

Bandaranaike Airport is truly international as it is really well maintained and has all the international standards. The immigration team is very efficient and helpful. As you leave the airport you don't come across lot of taut and thugs. But the airport charges everything in dollars which I found to be really pity as not all people are willing to pay 1000 times more for a product.

Recently visited Bandaranaike airport enroute from Thailand to India. Poorly run third or fourth world airport. Crowded with no amenities. The few outlets selling indigenous products seem to be government run: unfriendly and super expensive: for example a small bag of flavored cashews was and I’m not exaggerating:$20 yes twenty US dollars
A very attractive conference and exhibition center at the heart of Colombo gifted by the govt of Japan

This place is by far one of the best auditoriums in Sri Lanka. Before Nelum Pokuna , almost every important show was used to held here. Not only that but this is the main location for many other important ceremonies local and international alike.

BMICH - Bandaranayaka Memorial International Conference Hall is a gift to the SL government from Japan. Its centrally located in Colombo 07 in a huge land. The hall can be even seen from outside. There are functions in the premises most of the days. The water fountains makes it more attractive. There is a similar structure is built now in Hambantota district.
A very busy place. There is a conference, convocation or an exhibition taking place always. Ample parking available. Lot of greenery & shady trees.
This place is famous for Conferences , Exhibitions Conventions and you name it ....they have it. There are two venues inside this large centre. plenty of car parking and other facilities too.

The BMICH is the largest conference facility in Colombo and has various events throughout the year. We visited the International Book Fair which was largely a "local" book fair..! There were many marquees set up in the grounds. Traffic near the facility was almost at a standstill but our tuk tuk driver kindly took us to s useful side entrance.

I was a frequent visitor to BMICH for most of trade fairs and exhibitions, even though the facilities for exhibition are in exceptable standers. But dining facilities for exhibitors are very poor standers.. It's was located behind the conference hall with minimum facilities.. No proper seats to sit, looks like garbage collection center. In a rush day maitanatce of the wash rooms also very poor.. I think management should take steps to upgrade above facilities since lots of foreign clients utilities above facilities.. This can tarnish the country image too..
Best conference hall with ample parking and all the other infrastructure. Nice landscape and good to take photos.
Its broken, wet allover. Although each have a cleaner it looks filthy. I understand that we are backwashers and not wipers. However cant they keep it dry? Anyway better than indian ones.

This is where the SAARC summit was hosted the first time in Colombo, so was a great feeling to have seen the building with me being from India and learnt about the summit during school days. The building is pretty impressive along with the huge Buddha statue opposite it.
The best conference hall in Colombo for a big event. There are so many conventions taking place in this hall

A huge expanse of a place where this International conference hall is built. The setting is perfect with a water fountain in front of the building. This was a gift from China and was constructed during 1970 to 1073. It has a big library with books from most any subject which the delegates visiting can use for research.There have been a lot of events and exhibitions which were held here. It also hosted the 1976 Non Aligned Movement summit and also the Commonwealth Heads of Government meet in 2013. Lovely place.

Over 25+ years down the lane this is still the premier conference venue in Colombo. consisting of two main halls one Bandaranayaka memorial hall and the other Sirimavo Banadranayaka hall ( both named after husband and wife. both were prime ministers of Sri lanka the later being the first female PM of the world) Its available for exhibitions, work shops etc.
This is huge and ideal for large group convention or conference. It has adequate parking place and all the amenities which you require for holding an conference.

This Conference hall is a gift from China to the people of Sri-Lanka in memory of Late Mr.S.W.R.D. Bandaranaike who was a Prime minister of Ceyon as Sri- Lanka was called then.. The Non aligned conference was held here many years ago. This place is used for National & International conferences, but the outside area is mostly used for trade fairs which are very popular. A well maintained & beautiful place.

Its a convention centre located in Colombo. Known  as BMICH. This convention centre was a gift from the People's Republic of China in the memory 0f Solomon Ridgeway Dias Bandaranaike, who was the prime minister of Sri Lanka (Ceylon)
This is built by the Chinese  for the Non Aligned countries conference. Now it has some offices and exhibitions and events held here.Not a tourist attraction.
With its state of the art facilities, halls, convention rooms and halls - the Bandaranaike Memorial International Hall is the venue to hold a proper business meeting, exhibition or convention.
This is located in prime location and best place to have mega conferences and exhibitions in Sri Lanka.

For a conference in Colombo, my wife and I were in Colombo recently and had the occasion to attend the conference which was held in this facility which is world class with number of auditorium and seminar rooms and other facilities. The property is very well maintained and attractive with surrounding gardens very well manicured with good landscaping. It also as all the facilities that a conference needs.
The Bandaranaike Memorial International Conference Hall, A great convention center located in Colombo.

Known to be gifted by Chinese, this is indeed a beautiful architecture comparable to White house in US. Huge lawn outside the building till the fence of the POI. Has a good presence and grand feel to the entire place.
